item.title: Week of June 26th
item.dc:creator: Shelly Williams
item.description:
*Creek County Fair

Come to CREEK COUNTY FAIR for some good ole fashioned fun! YEE-HAW! Our best summer event by far! Games, hay rides, cookout, and square-dancing await each of our families! What an incredible night of fellowship and fun! See you Saturday, July 15th, from 6:00-9:00 p.m . You won’t want to miss it! We would love for you to jump in and help by signing up at curreycreek.com/kidsevents

*Students Summer Events

Camp Winiwaca - Please pray for our leaders and middle school friends as they leave tomorrow for camp through July 2nd!  

Camp Eagle - July 23rd-28th
We can’t wait for this summer adventure with our High School students! We will rock climb, kayak, hike, camp out under the stars, all while encountering God and worshiping Him together. This will be a time for us to come together and dream of how next year’s
HS Upstream can participate in building the Kingdom! Please visit curreycreek.com/summer for all the information and registration links. 

Summer Upstream Dates:   Wednesdays, July 5th, 12th & 19th from 6 - 8 p.m.

*Tech Worship Clinic

Whether you are already serving in the tech ministry or are just now getting involved, come to our Tech Worship Clinic on Saturday July 8th. It will be from 9:30 AM to 3:30 PM. Lunch will be provided! During this time you will get hands on experience with all of the tech that we use for worship such as ProPresenter 6,our Midas Pro2C Audio Board, the lighting programmer, and our video switcher. Go to www.curreycreek.com/worshipclinics and follow the link to register. Hope to see you there!

*Baptism Sunday

If you have an interest in getting baptized, please call the church office at (830)755-8806 to set up an appointment with a pastor.  Our next Baptism Sunday is July 16th immediately after each service.

*Home Group Leader Interest
 
Have you felt a tug at your heart to start a small group? Have you been involved in small groups and are ready to take the next step into leadership? We would love to set up a meeting with you to discuss our heart for small groups at Currey Creek and how you can start your own home group during our Hebrews fall study. For more information, email Jared at jpatrick@curreycreek.com.

*Small Groups Pastor

We are excited to announce that we are in the process of hiring a Small Groups Pastor. This person will be responsible for ensuring that the congregation is connecting with one another and building community through a strong, healthy small groups ministry. Please be in prayer for God’s direction for this position. If you have any questions, please contact Jared at jared@curreycreek.com.

*Cultivate Women's Event with Kelly Minter

Save the Date!  You are invited to our Fall 2017 "Cultivate" Women's Event on Friday, November 10th from 7:00 p.m. - 9:00 p.m. and Saturday, November 11th from 8:30-12:30 p.m. in the Worship Center. Join us for fellowship, worship, and learning God's Word with guest speaker Kelly Minter.  To register, please visit www.curreycreek.com/cultivate.

*Cultivate Women's Event with Kelly Minter

Save the Date!  You are invited to our Fall 2017 "Cultivate" Women's Event on Friday, November 10th from 7:00 p.m. - 9:00 p.m. and Saturday, November 11th from 8:30-12:30 p.m. in the Worship Center. Join us for fellowship, worship, and learning God's Word with guest speaker Kelly Minter.  To register, please visit www.curreycreek.com/cultivate.

item.title: Week of June 19th
item.dc:creator: Shelly Williams
item.description:
*Atheism Conference - THIS FRIDAY & SATURDAY

After encountering Atheists, many Christians feel discouraged; is our Faith able to be supported with legitimate evidence, or do we just have to hold on to "blind faith"? Is the God of the Bible actually good and worth following-- and if so, how can we reconcile the picture of a loving Savior with the picture of an angry God people sometimes depict from the Old Testament? In Understanding and Answering Atheism, a seminar by Ravi Zacharias International Ministries, we'll learn how to honestly examine our faith, and how to be challenged-- as well as how to lovingly and constructively engage the Atheists we know. The conference takes place on THIS Friday and Saturday. Please register at www.curreycreek.com/creekinstitute by Thursday, June 22.

*Students Summer Events

*Camp Winiwaca - June 28th-July 2nd  - Sign up by THIS FRIDAY, June 23rd!  Just 1 week left before we leave for our Middle School camp for current 6th - 8th grade!  

Camp Eagle - July 23rd-28th
We can’t wait for this summer adventure with our High School students! We will rock climb, kayak, hike, camp out under the stars, all while encountering God and worshiping Him together. This will be a time for us to come together and dream o  how next year’s
HS Upstream can participate in building the Kingdom! Please visit curreycreek.com/summer for all the information and registration links. 

Summer Upstream Dates:    Wednesdays, July 5th, 12th & 19th from 6 - 8 p.m.

*Creek County Fair

Come to CREEK COUNTY FAIR for some good ole fashioned fun! YEE-HAW! Our best summer event by far! Games, hay rides, cookout, and square-dancing await each of our families! What an incredible night of fellowship and fun! See you Saturday, July 15th, from 6:00-9:00 p.m. You won’t want to miss it! We would love for you to jump in and help by signing up at curreycreek.com/kidsevents. 

*Tech Worship Clinic

Whether you are already serving in the tech ministry or are just now getting involved, come to our Tech Worship Clinic on Saturday July 8th. It will be from 9:30 AM to 3:30 PM. Lunch will be provided! During this time you will get hands on experience with all of the tech that we use for worship such as ProPresenter 6,our Midas Pro2C Audio Board, the lighting programmer, and our video switcher. Go towww.curreycreek.com/worshipclinics and follow the link to register. Hope to see you there!

*Home Group Leader Interest
 
Have you felt a tug at your heart to start a small group? Have you been involved in small groups and are ready to take the next step into leadership? We would love to set up a meeting with you to discuss our heart for small groups at Currey Creek and how you can start your own home group during our Hebrews fall study. For more information, email Jared at jpatrick@curreycreek.com.

*Cultivate Women's Event with Kelly Minter

Save the Date!  You are invited to our Fall 2017 "Cultivate" Women's Event on Friday, November 10th from 7:00 p.m. - 9:00 p.m. and Saturday, November 11th from 8:30-12:30 p.m. in the Worship Center. Join us for fellowship, worship, and learning God's Word with guest speaker Kelly Minter.  To register, please visit www.curreycreek.com/cultivate.

*Serve The Homeless This Summer

Taking It to the Streets ministry to our homeless community in downtown San Antonio is in need of volunteers to provide a meal and the love of Christ to our friends in need. Gather a group of friends and sign up to cook dinner one Saturday night out of the summer – and be a part of restoring dignity and community to the homeless as we fellowship together. For more information go to https://www.takingittothestreets.com/
item.content:encoded:

After encountering Atheists, many Christians feel discouraged; is our Faith able to be supported with legitimate evidence, or do we just have to hold on to "blind faith"? Is the God of the Bible actually good and worth following-- and if so, how can we reconcile the picture of a loving Savior with the picture of an angry God people sometimes depict from the Old Testament? In Understanding and Answering Atheism, a seminar by Ravi Zacharias International Ministries, we'll learn how to honestly examine our faith, and how to be challenged-- as well as how to lovingly and constructively engage the Atheists we know. The conference takes place on THIS Friday and Saturday. Please register at www.curreycreek.com/creekinstitute by Thursday, June 22.

*Students Summer Events

*Camp Winiwaca - June 28th-July 2nd  - Sign up by THIS FRIDAY, June 23rd!  Just 1 week left before we leave for our Middle School camp for current 6th - 8th grade!

We can’t wait for this summer adventure with our High School students! We will rock climb, kayak, hike, camp out under the stars, all while encountering God and worshiping Him together. This will be a time for us to come together and dream o  how next year’s
HS Upstream can participate in building the Kingdom! Please visit curreycreek.com/summer for all the information and registration links. 

Summer Upstream Dates:    Wednesdays, July 5th, 12th & 19th from 6 - 8 p.m.

*Creek County Fair

Come to CREEK COUNTY FAIR for some good ole fashioned fun! YEE-HAW! Our best summer event by far! Games, hay rides, cookout, and square-dancing await each of our families! What an incredible night of fellowship and fun! See you Saturday, July 15th, from 6:00-9:00 p.m. You won’t want to miss it! We would love for you to jump in and help by signing up at curreycreek.com/kidsevents. 

*Tech Worship Clinic

Whether you are already serving in the tech ministry or are just now getting involved, come to our Tech Worship Clinic on Saturday July 8th. It will be from 9:30 AM to 3:30 PM. Lunch will be provided! During this time you will get hands on experience with all of the tech that we use for worship such as ProPresenter 6,our Midas Pro2C Audio Board, the lighting programmer, and our video switcher. Go towww.curreycreek.com/worshipclinics and follow the link to register. Hope to see you there!

*Home Group Leader Interest
 
Have you felt a tug at your heart to start a small group? Have you been involved in small groups and are ready to take the next step into leadership? We would love to set up a meeting with you to discuss our heart for small groups at Currey Creek and how you can start your own home group during our Hebrews fall study. For more information, email Jared at jpatrick@curreycreek.com.

*Cultivate Women's Event with Kelly Minter

Save the Date!  You are invited to our Fall 2017 "Cultivate" Women's Event on Friday, November 10th from 7:00 p.m. - 9:00 p.m. and Saturday, November 11th from 8:30-12:30 p.m. in the Worship Center. Join us for fellowship, worship, and learning God's Word with guest speaker Kelly Minter.  To register, please visit www.curreycreek.com/cultivate.

*Serve The Homeless This Summer

Taking It to the Streets ministry to our homeless community in downtown San Antonio is in need of volunteers to provide a meal and the love of Christ to our friends in need. Gather a group of friends and sign up to cook dinner one Saturday night out of the summer – and be a part of restoring dignity and community to the homeless as we fellowship together. For more information go to https://www.takingittothestreets.com/

item.title: Week of June 12th
item.dc:creator: Shelly Williams
item.description:
*Summer At The Creek

Starting THIS Sunday, Breakfast Club and Elementary will not meet throughout the summer as we have all family worship (only birth through 5  year olds will be offered during the summer).  As a reminder, our summer service times are 9:00 & 10:30 a.m.

*Students Summer Events - be in prayer for all our kids/adults serving at Blueprint Ministries this week!

Camp Winiwaca - June 28th-July 2nd                     Our Middle School camp for current 6th - 8th grade is filling up fast! We will abide in Christ and worship our Savior, all while having a great summer camp experience!  You don't want to miss out so register today!

Camp Eagle - July 23rd-28th
We can’t wait for this summer adventure with our High School students! We will rock climb, kayak, hike, camp out under the stars, all while encountering God and worshiping Him together. This will be a time for us to come together and dream of how next year’s
HS Upstream can participate in building the Kingdom! Please visit curreycreek.com/summer for all the information and registration links. 

*Atheism Conference

“Understanding and Answering Atheism” is a conference led by Ravi Zacharias International Ministries designed for students, families, small groups, churches and anyone interested in the rising challenge of atheism to the Christian worldview. The conference is on June 23rd from 5-8 p.m. and June 24th from 8-3:30 p.m. in our Chapel. Lunch will be provided with registration. To register, visit www.curreycreek.com/creekinstitute.  

*Baptism Sunday

If you have an interest in getting baptized, please call the church office at (830)755-8806 to set up an appointment with a pastor by today, June 13th.  Our next Baptism Sunday is THIS Sunday, immediately after each service.

*Creek County Fair

Come to CREEK COUNTY FAIR for some good ole fashioned fun! YEE-HAW! Our best summer event by far! Games, hay rides, cookout, and square-dancing await each of our families! What an incredible night of fellowship and fun! See you Saturday, July 15th, from 6:00-9:00 p.m.  Look for a church-wide sign-up for ways to volunteer and love on families.

*Cultivate Women's Event with Kelly Minter

Save the Date!  You are invited to our Fall 2017 "Cultivate" Women's Event on Friday, November 10th from 7:00 p.m. - 9:00 p.m. and Saturday, November 11th from 8:30-12:30 p.m. in the Worship Center. Join us for fellowship, worship, and learning God's Word with guest speaker Kelly Minter.  To register, please visit www.curreycreek.com/cultivate.

*Serve the homeless this summer

Taking It to the Streets ministry to our homeless community in downtown San Antonio is in need of volunteers to provide a meal and the love of Christ to our friends in need. Gather a group of friends and sign up to cook dinner one Saturday night out of the summer – and be a part of restoring dignity and community to the homeless as we fellowship together. For more information go to https://www.takingittothestreets.com/

*Happy Father's Day to all the dads!  We are thankful for you!

item.title: Week of June 5th
item.dc:creator: Shelly Williams
item.description:
*Summer At The Creek

Just a reminder that we started our NEW SUMMER SERVICE TIMES! The first service begins at 9:00 a.m. and the second service begins at 10:30 a.m.  Breakfast Club (Student) ministry & Creek Kids will meet this Sunday June 11th.  Starting June 18th Breakfast Club and Elementary will not meet throughout the summer (only birth through 5  year olds will be offered during the summer).

*Serve the homeless this summer

Taking It to the Streets ministry to our homeless community in downtown San Antonio is in need of volunteers to provide a meal and the love of Christ to our friends in need. Gather a group of friends and sign up to cook dinner one Saturday night out of the summer – and be a part of restoring dignity and community to the homeless as we fellowship together. For more information go to https://www.takingittothestreets.com/

*Students Summer Events 

  • Camp Winiwaca - June 28th-July 2nd                                                          Our Middle School camp for current 6th - 8th grade is filling up fast! We will abide in Christ and worship our Savior, all while having a great summer camp experience!  You don't want to miss out so register today!
  • Camp Eagle - July 23rd-28th
    We can’t wait for this summer adventure with our High School students! We will rock climb, kayak, hike, camp out under the stars, all while encountering God and worshiping Him together. This will be a time for us to come together and dream of how next year’s HS Upstream can participate in building the Kingdom! Please visit curreycreek.com/summer for all the information and registration links. 

*Baptism Sunday

If you have an interest in getting baptized, please call the church office at (830)755-8806 to set up an appointment with a pastor.  Our next Baptism Sunday is Father's Day, June 18th immediately after each service.
 
*Atheism Conference

“Understanding and Answering Atheism” is a conference led by Ravi Zacharias International Ministries designed for students, families, small groups, churches and anyone interested in the rising challenge of atheism to the Christian worldview. The conference is on June 23rd from 5-8 p.m. and June 24th from 8-3:30 p.m. in our Chapel. Lunch will be provided with registration. To register, visit www.curreycreek.com/creekinstitute.  

*Creek County Fair

Come to CREEK COUNTY FAIR for some good ole fashioned fun! YEE-HAW! Our best summer event by far! Games, hay rides, cookout, and square-dancing await each of our families! What an incredible night of fellowship and fun! See you Saturday, July 15th, from 6:00-9:00 p.m.  Look for a church-wide sign-up for ways to volunteer and love on families.

*Cultivate Women's Event with Kelly Minter

Save the Date!  You are invited to our Fall 2017 "Cultivate" Women's Event on Friday, November 10th from 7:00 p.m. - 9:00 p.m. and Saturday, November 11th from 8:30-12:30 p.m. in the Worship Center. Join us for fellowship, worship, and learning God's Word with guest speaker Kelly Minter.  To register, please visitwww.curreycreek.com/cultivate.

item.title: Week of May 29th
item.dc:creator: Shelly Williams
item.description:
*Summer At The Creek

Don't forget we started our NEW SUMMER SERVICE TIMES! The first service begins at 9:00 a.m. and the second service begins at 10:30 a.m.  Breakfast Club (Student) ministry & Creek Kids will meet this Sunday June 4th.

*Students Summer Events

Camp Winiwaca - June 28th - July 2nd                                                                              Our Middle School camp for current 6th - 8th grade is filling up fast! We will abide in Christ and worship our Savior, all while having a great summer camp experience! Late Registration begins June 1st so register today!

Camp Eagle - July 23rd-28th
We can’t wait for this summer adventure with our High School students! We will rock climb, kayak, hike, camp out under the stars, all while encountering God and worshiping Him together. This will be a time for us to come together and dream of how next year’s
HS Upstream can participate in building the Kingdom! Please visit curreycreek.com/summer for all the information and registration links.

If you have an interest in getting baptized, please call the church office at (830)755-8806 to set up an appointment with a pastor.  Our next Baptism Sunday is Father's Day, June 18th immediately after each service.
 
*Atheism Conference

“Understanding and Answering Atheism” is a conference led by Ravi Zacharias International Ministries designed for students, families, small groups, churches and anyone interested in the rising challenge of atheism to the Christian worldview. The conference is on June 23rd from 5-8 p.m. and June 24th from 8-3:30 p.m. in our Chapel. Lunch will be provided with registration. To register, visit www.curreycreek.com/creekinstitute.  

*Cultivate Women's Event with Kelly Minter

Save the Date!  You are invited to our Fall 2017 "Cultivate" Women's Event on Friday, November 10th from 7:00 p.m. - 9:00 p.m. and Saturday, November 11th from 8:30-12:30 p.m. in the Worship Center. Join us for fellowship, worship, and learning God's Word with guest speaker Kelly Minter.  To register, please visitwww.curreycreek.com/cultivate.

*Creek County Fair

Come to CREEK COUNTY FAIR for some good ole fashioned fun! YEE-HAW! Our best summer event by far! Games, hay rides, cookout, and square-dancing await each of our families! What an incredible night of fellowship and fun! See you Saturday, July 15th, from 6:00-9:00 p.m.  Look for a church-wide sign-up for ways to volunteer and love on families.

*Israel Trip 2018

You don’t want to miss this amazing trip to Israel in 2018! Registration is open for the 2018 Israel Trip with Pastor John & Darla! The trip is taking place March 9th - 19th, 
2018.  All you need to do now is pay a $500 deposit per person; the remainder is not due until January 2018.  This deposit will be fully refundable until December 1, 2017. 
For information and registration go online to http://www.curreycreek.com/israel.
item.content:encoded:
*Summer At The Creek

Don't forget we started our NEW SUMMER SERVICE TIMES! The first service begins at 9:00 a.m. and the second service begins at 10:30 a.m.  Breakfast Club (Student) ministry & Creek Kids will meet this Sunday June 4th.

*Students Summer Events

Camp Winiwaca - June 28th - July 2nd                                                                              Our Middle School camp for current 6th - 8th grade is filling up fast! We will abide in Christ and worship our Savior, all while having a great summer camp experience! Late Registration begins June 1st so register today!

Camp Eagle - July 23rd-28th
We can’t wait for this summer adventure with our High School students! We will rock climb, kayak, hike, camp out under the stars, all while encountering God and worshiping Him together. This will be a time for us to come together and dream of how next year’s
HS Upstream can participate in building the Kingdom! Please visit curreycreek.com/summer for all the information and registration links. 

*Baptism Sunday

If you have an interest in getting baptized, please call the church office at (830)755-8806 to set up an appointment with a pastor.  Our next Baptism Sunday is Father's Day, June 18th immediately after each service.
 
*Atheism Conference

“Understanding and Answering Atheism” is a conference led by Ravi Zacharias International Ministries designed for students, families, small groups, churches and anyone interested in the rising challenge of atheism to the Christian worldview. The conference is on June 23rd from 5-8 p.m. and June 24th from 8-3:30 p.m. in our Chapel. Lunch will be provided with registration. To register, visit www.curreycreek.com/creekinstitute.  

*Cultivate Women's Event with Kelly Minter

Save the Date!  You are invited to our Fall 2017 "Cultivate" Women's Event on Friday, November 10th from 7:00 p.m. - 9:00 p.m. and Saturday, November 11th from 8:30-12:30 p.m. in the Worship Center. Join us for fellowship, worship, and learning God's Word with guest speaker Kelly Minter.  To register, please visitwww.curreycreek.com/cultivate.

*Creek County Fair

Come to CREEK COUNTY FAIR for some good ole fashioned fun! YEE-HAW! Our best summer event by far! Games, hay rides, cookout, and square-dancing await each of our families! What an incredible night of fellowship and fun! See you Saturday, July 15th, from 6:00-9:00 p.m.  Look for a church-wide sign-up for ways to volunteer and love on families.

*Israel Trip 2018

You don’t want to miss this amazing trip to Israel in 2018! Registration is open for the 2018 Israel Trip with Pastor John & Darla! The trip is taking place March 9th - 19th, 
2018.  All you need to do now is pay a $500 deposit per person; the remainder is not due until January 2018.  This deposit will be fully refundable until December 1, 2017. 
For information and registration go online to http://www.curreycreek.com/israel.

THIS Sunday, May 28th we start our NEW SUMMER SERVICE TIMES! The first service begins at 9:00 a.m. and the second service begins at 10:30 a.m.  Breakfast Club (Student) ministry will not meet on May 28th.  Nursery and preschool only in Creek Kids on May 28th.

2018.  All you need to do now is pay a $500 deposit per person; the remainder is not due until January 2018.  This deposit will be fully refundable until December 1, 2017.

We can’t wait for this summer adventure with our High School students! We will rock climb, kayak, hike, camp out under the stars, all while encountering God and worshiping Him together. This will be a time for us to come together and dream of how next year’s

“Understanding and Answering Atheism” is a conference led by Ravi Zacharias International Ministries designed for students, families, small groups, churches and anyone interested in the rising challenge of atheism to the Christian worldview. Join us for fellowship, worship, and learning God's Word with guest speaker Kelly Minter.  To register, please visit www.curreycreek.com/cultivate.

Our offices will be closed this Monday in observance of Memorial Day.

item.title: May 5, 2017
item.dc:creator: Shelly Williams
item.description:
*Summer At The Creek

Mark your calendars for Sunday, May 28th as we start our NEW SUMMER SERVICE TIMES! We will only have 2 services throughout the summer instead of 3. The first service begins at 9:00 a.m. and the second service begins at 10:30 a.m. Breakfast Club (Student) ministry will not meet on May 28th. Nursery and preschool only in Creek Kids on May 28th.

*Israel Trip Interest Meeting

Don't miss the Israel Trip Interest Meeting THIS Sunday, May 21st at 11:30 a.m. in the Chapel! We would love for you to join John & Darla on this AMAZING trip over Spring Break of 2018. The trip will take place March 9th - 19th, 2018. To register or for more information, please visit www.curreycreek.com/israel.

*Senior Sunday

Join us THIS Sunday, May 21st at the 10:15 a.m. service. We have planned a time to honor our Senior graduates. We will have a slideshow of all the graduates, a special time of prayer, and the presentation of a gift.

*Understanding Atheism Conference

“Understanding and Answering Atheism” is a conference led by Ravi Zacharias International Ministries designed for students, families, small groups, churches and anyone interested in the rising challenge of atheism to the Christian worldview. The conference is on June 23rd from 5-8pm and June 24th from 8-3:30pm in our Chapel. Lunch will be provided with registration. To register, visit www.curreycreek.com/creekinstitute.

*Students Summer Events Registration

Spots are going quick! Registration is open for all of our High School and Middle School camps for this upcoming summer! Please visit curreycreek.com/summer for all the information and registration links. You won’t want to miss it!

*Nicaragua Summer Mission Trip

Limited available spaces for the Nicaragua Mission trip this summer! Currey Creek is preparing for our summer mission trip to Nicaragua on July 12th - 17th. Contact Steve Balthrop at 210-827-7112 if you are interested or for more information.

*Annual Nicaragua Kids Back to School

Thank you for such a great response to send a child back to school in Nicaragua. If you picked up an envelope and still need to drop off a donation, please bring it to the Connection Desk this Sunday. Thank you again for your support.

*Cultivate Women's Event with Kelly Minter

Save the Date! You are invited to our Fall 2017 "Cultivate" Women's Event on Friday, November 10th from 7:00 p.m. - 9:00 p.m. and Saturday, November 11th from 8:30-12:30 p.m. in the Worship Center. Join us for fellowship, worship, and learning God's Word with guest speaker Kelly Minter. To register, please visit www.curreycreek.com/cultivate.

Limited available spaces for the Nicaragua Mission trip this summer! Currey Creek is preparing for our summer mission trip to Nicaragua on July 12th - 17th. Contact Steve Balthrop at 210-827-7112 if you are interested or for more information.

*Annual Nicaragua Kids Back to School

Thank you for such a great response to send a child back to school in Nicaragua. If you picked up an envelope and still need to drop off a donation, please bring it to the Connection Desk this Sunday. Thank you again for your support.

*Cultivate Women's Event with Kelly Minter

Save the Date! You are invited to our Fall 2017 "Cultivate" Women's Event on Friday, November 10th from 7:00 p.m. - 9:00 p.m. and Saturday, November 11th from 8:30-12:30 p.m. in the Worship Center. Join us for fellowship, worship, and learning God's Word with guest speaker Kelly Minter. To register, please visit www.curreycreek.com/cultivate.

item.title: Week of May 8th
item.dc:creator: Shelly Williams
item.description:
*Summer At The Creek

Mark your calendars for Sunday, May 28th as we start our NEW SUMMER SERVICE TIMES! We will only have 2 services throughout summer instead of 3. The first service begins at 9:00 a.m. and the second service begins at 10:30 a.m. Details coming soon regarding Creek Kids and Student ministry meeting dates & times.

*Annual Nicaragua Kids Back to School

You can help send a child back to school in Nicaragua. A $30 donation will provide needed uniforms, supplies, and backpacks to a child from our sister church, King of Kings. Information will be available at Currey Creek THIS Sunday, May 14th. You can write a check to Currey Creek and put "Nicaragua" in the memo line. Thank you so much!

*Creek Kids

Please join us THIS Friday evening, May 12th for Illuminate, our END-Of-THE-YEAR family celebration!!! We will have food, fun, games, and glow-in-the-dark praise and worship! This event will be in our 2-story building from 5:00-7:00. Please RSVP your family at www.curreycreek.com/kidsevents.

*Israel Trip Interest Meeting

You are invited to an Israel Trip Interest Meeting on Sunday, May 21st at 11:30 a.m. in the Chapel! We would love for you to join John & Darla on this AMAZING trip over Spring Break of 2018. The trip will take place March 9th - 19th, 2018. To register or for more information, please visit www.curreycreek.com/israel.

*Senior Sunday

Calling all Seniors! Sunday, May 21st at the 10:15 a.m. service, we have planned a time to honor our Senior graduates. We will have a slideshow of all the graduates, a special time of prayer, and the presentation of a gift. We need a baby picture and current picture of your senior to us no later than May 15th. Please submit these photos in a digital form (email or on a CD). Also, please list 1 or 2 teams/groups/accomplishments your graduate was a part of in high school as well as their future plans. Please email your photos, to us at students@curreycreek.com. If you have any questions, please call us at 830.755.8806.

*Students Summer Events Registration

Registration is open for all of our High School and Middle School camps and mission trip for this upcoming summer! Please visit curreycreek.com/summer for all the information and registration links.

*Nicaragua Summer Mission Trip

Ready to jump into foreign missions? Currey Creek is preparing for our summer mission trip to Nicaragua on July 12th - 17th. Anyone interested is invited to an informational
meeting. Contact missions@curreycreek.com for more information.

*A Time To Plant Updates

If you missed the update from A Time to Plant please go to www.curreycreek.com/campaign to see the updates.

*Understanding Atheism Conference

“Understanding and Answering Atheism” is a conference led by Ravi Zacharias International Ministries designed for students, families, small groups, churches and anyone interested in the rising challenge of atheism to the Christian worldview. The conference is on June 23rd from 5-8pm and June 24th from 8-3:30pm in our Chapel. Lunch will be provided with registration. To register, visit www.curreycreek.com/creekinstitute.

*Baptism Sunday

If you are interested in getting baptized, please call the church office to set up an appointment at (830)755-8806. Our next Baptism Sunday is Sunday, May 21st immediately after each service.

 

***Happy Mother's Day on May 14th ***

*Young Life Golf Tournament

Help us continue to reach kids for Christ in Boerne and have a great day golfing!! Our annual Golf Classic will be held at the prestigious Fair Oaks Country Club NEXT MONDAY, May 8th at 11:30 a.m. Click here to register for this great afternoon of food, fun, fellowship & golf. Email Danny if you have any questions!
